oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Whites Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with the Whites (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: The Whites; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Sharon White discusses Cheryl White's success in country -- (00:52) Cheryl recalls how Capitol Records attempted to change their group image -- (01:44) Buck White discusses listening to KWFT and other radio stations growing up; additionally, Buck describes the early stages of his instrumental career -- (04:58) Cheryl recalls the first time her mother met Buck was through Cheryl's grandmother -- (06:01) Buck describes the Hillbilly Circus -- (06:59) Cheryl reveals one of the biggest shows they did was at a cattle auction -- (07:46) Buck describes how he used to perform live with a different band in his youth -- (09:10) Cheryl, Sharon, and Buck describe Sharon and Cheryl's grandmother's teasing -- (09:52) Biff Collie has Buck reflect on his wife's instrumental career -- (12:05) Sharon and Cheryl recall a time they forgot their nap sacks on stage; The Whites recall their first hit -- (13:35) Collie has the girls reflect on their education -- (15:24) Cheryl recalls how moving to the country affected their father's musical aspirations -- (17:02) Cheryl and Buck reflect on the girls ability to practice in school -- (20:00) The Whites reflect on when they moved to Arkansas after Buck updated an old house -- (21:51) Buck recalls how the band used to be called the Down Homed Folks; Buck recalls making his own posters to advertise the group -- (23:34) Sharon describes Bucks desire to perform in front of an audience -- (25:01) Collie and Sharon discuss Sharon's niece Molly's refusal to get on the Grand Ole Opry stage -- (27:57) Collie and Buck discuss how Marvin McQualla (unconfirmed) had the Whites perform on his television show -- (29:30) Buck, Sharon, and Cheryl tell about the time they performed with the Brothers Osborne; Sharon describes the fears they had prior to moving to Nashville -- (34:04) Buck describes the time where he was working, and the Whites describe what happened when they recorded their first tape -- (36:23) Sharon recalls how she had practiced singing while learning the guitar -- (37:30) Cheryl discusses how Emmylou Harris sang with the group in Washington D.C.; Cheryl discusses how Harris encouraged the White's country careers -- (40:30) Buck recalls how he accidently started playing piano instead of mandolin; Sharon discusses how they had to request pianos at their shows -- (41:46) Sharon describes the time where Ricky Skaggs would book himself along with the Whites -- (44:14) Collie has the Whites recall a story about Christmas bicycles -- (47:30) The Whites recall their touring expedition of Asia -- (49:38) Sharon and Cheryl discuss the circumstances behind how Sharon wound up marrying Skaggs -- (50:46) Buck attributes his religious upbringing to the White's long tenure -- (51:21) The Whites reflect on being accepting into the Grand Ole Opry and the work required to get to that point -- (53:27) Buck discusses how they had yet to have a number one hit, but they have accomplished a large amount
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: the Whites (Musical group); White, Buck; White, Cheryl, 1955-; White, Sharon; White, Sharon, 1953 December 17-; Collie, Biff;
